Package camzup.core

Class Color

java.lang.Object
camzup.core.Color
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<Color>
public class Color extends Object implements Comparable<Color>
A mutable, extensible color class. Assumes red, green and blue color channels are in the standard RGB (sRGB) color space. Converts to and from integers where color channels are in the format 0xAARRGGBB.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static class 
    Color.AbstrEasing
    An abstract class to facilitate the creation of color easing functions.
    static class 
    Color.HueCCW
    Eases between hues in the clockwise direction.
    static class 
    Color.HueCW
    Eases the hue in the counter-clockwise direction.
    static class 
    Color.HueEasing
    An abstract parent class for hue easing functions.
    static class 
    Color.HueFar
    Eases between hues by the farthest rotational direction.
    static class 
    Color.HueNear
    Eases between hues by the nearest rotational direction.
    static class 
    Color.MixCieLab
    Eases between two colors in CIE LAB color space.
    static class 
    Color.MixCieLch
    Eases between two colors in CIE LCH color space.
    static class 
    Color.MixLrgb
    Converts two colors from standard RGB to linear RGB, mixes them with linear interpolation, then converts back to standard RGB.
    static class 
    Color.MixSrgb
    Eases between two colors in sRGB, i.e., with no gamma correction.

      The green channel.

    • r

      public float r
      The red channel.

    • CIE_LCH_HUE_LIGHT

      public static final float CIE_LCH_HUE_LIGHT
      Arbitrary hue in CIE LCH assigned to colors with no saturation that are closer to light, 0.2750000059604645f. Defaults to a yellow.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • CIE_LCH_HUE_SHADOW

      public static final float CIE_LCH_HUE_SHADOW
      Arbitrary hue in CIE LCH assigned to colors with no saturation that are closer to shadow, 0.855555534362793f. Defaults to a violet.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

      public Color()
      The default constructor. Creates a white color.

      public Color(byte red, byte green, byte blue)
      Creates a color from bytes. In Java, bytes are signed, within the range [0x80, 0x7f] .

      green - the green channel

    • Color

      public Color(float red, float green, float blue)
      Creates a color out of red, green and blue channels. The alpha channel defaults to 1.0 .
      Parameters:
      red - the red channel
      green - the green channel
      blue - the blue channel

    • Color

      public Color(float red, float green, float blue, float alpha)
      Creates a color out of red, green, blue and alpha channels. The expected range for each channel is [0.0, 1.0], however these bounds are not checked so as to facilitate color mixing in other color spaces.
      Parameters:
      red - the red channel
      green - the green channel
      blue - the blue channel
      alpha - the alpha channel

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo(Color c)
      Returns -1 when this color is less than the comparisand; 1 when it is greater than; 0 when the two are 'equal'. The implementation of this method allows collections of colors to be sorted.

      public Color set(float red, float green, float blue, float alpha)
      Overrides the parent set function for the sake of making RGB parameters clearer and for chainability. The expected range for each channel is [0.0, 1.0], however these bounds are not checked so as to facilitate color mixing in other color spaces.

    • bitRotateLeft

      public static Color bitRotateLeft(Color a, int places, Color target)
      Converts a color to an integer, rotates to the left by the number of places, then converts the result to a color. The rotate a whole color channel, use increments of 8 (8, 16, 24).
      Parameters:

      places - the number of places
      target - the output color
      Returns:
      the rotated color

    • cieLabToCieLch

      public static Vec4 cieLabToCieLch(float l, float a, float b, float alpha, Vec4 target)
      Converts a color from CIE LAB to CIE LCH. The output is organized as z: L or lightness, y: C or chroma, x: h or hue, w: alpha. The returned hue is in the range [0.0, 1.0] .
      Parameters:
      l - the lightness
      a - the green to red range
      b - the blue to yellow range
      alpha - the alpha channel
      target - the output vector
      Returns:
      the LCh vector
      See Also:
      • Utils.clamp01(float)
      • Utils.mod1(float)

    • cieLabToCieLch

      public static Vec4 cieLabToCieLch(Vec4 source, Vec4 target)
      Converts a color from CIE LAB to CIE LCH. The source should be organized as z: L or lightness, x: a or green-red, y: b or blue-yellow, w: alpha. The output is organized as z: L or lightness, y: C or chroma, x: h or hue, w: alpha. The returned hue is in the range [0.0, 1.0] .
      Parameters:
      source - the lab vector
      target - the output vector
      Returns:
      the LCh color

      b - the blue to yellow range

    • fromHex

      public static Color fromHex(String c, Color target)
      Attempts to convert a hexadecimal String to a color. Recognized formats include:
      • "abc" - RGB, one digit per channel.
      • "#abc" - hash tag, RGB, one digit per channel.
      • "aabbcc" - RRGGBB, two digits per channel.
      • "#aabbcc" - hash tag, RRGGBB, two digits per channel.
      • "aabbccdd" - AARRGGBB, two digits per channel.
      • "0xaabbccdd" - '0x' prefix, AARRGGBB, two digits per channel.
      The output color will be reset if no suitable format is recognized.
      Parameters:
      c - the input String
      target - the output color
      Returns:
      the color
      See Also:
      • fromHex(int, Color)
      • Integer.parseInt(String, int)
      • Long.parseLong(String, int)
      • String.replaceAll(String, String)
      • String.substring(int)

    • fromHex

      public static Color[] fromHex(String[] cs)
      Converts an array of Strings that represent colors in hexadecimal into an array of colors
      Parameters:
      cs - the colors
      Returns:
      the array
      See Also:
      • fromHex(String, Color)

      public static String toGplString(Color[] arr, String name)

      Returns:
      the string

    • toGplString

      public static String toGplString(Color[] arr, String name, int cols, boolean useIdx)
      Returns a String representing the color array in the GIMP palette file format. The number of columns is for displaying the palette. A flag indicates whether or not to append the color's index as the final column of each row. Indices begin at 1, not 0.
      Parameters:

      name - the palette name
      cols - the display columns
      useIdx - append the index
      Returns:
      the string

      public static String toHexWeb(Color c)

      Parameters:
      c - the color
      Returns:
      the string
      See Also:
      • toHexWeb(StringBuilder, Color)

    • toHexWeb

      public static String toHexWeb(int c)
      Returns a web-friendly representation of the color as a hexadecimal code, preceded by a hash tag, '#', with no alpha. Assumes the number will be formatted as 0xAARRGGBB , where alpha is the first channel, followed by red, green and blue.
      Parameters:
      c - the color
      Returns:
      the string
      See Also:
      • toHexWeb(StringBuilder, int)

      public static StringBuilder toHexWeb(StringBuilder sb, int c)
      Creates a web-friendly representation of the color as a hexadecimal code, preceded by a hash tag, '#', with no alpha. Appends to an existing StringBuilder.

      Assumes the number will be formatted as 0xAARRGGBB , where alpha is the first channel, followed by red, green and blue.
      Parameters:
      sb - the string builder
      c - the color
      Returns:
      the string builder
      See Also:

    • unpremul

      public static Color unpremul(Color c, Color target)
      Divides the red, green and blue color channels of a color by the alpha channel; reverses premul(Color, Color).
      Parameters:
      c - the input color
      target - the output color
      Returns:
      the divided color
